landlord_tenant_relationship.reasoning: Complaint alleges Plaintiff took possession of the premises, has continuously paid monthly rent to Defendant since April 1, 2022, and identifies Defendant as the landlord—facts that sufficiently pleads a landlord-tenant relationship.

act_or_omission_by_landlord.reasoning: Complaint alleges Defendant was notified of the loss of hot water, ordered a part, and then failed to restore service over a multi-week period—an omission (failure to repair/restore essential service) by the landlord.

substantial_interference.reasoning: Complaint alleges a prolonged (≈three-week) deprivation of essential hot water, forcing Plaintiff to use a gym to shower, preventing in-home bathing of an infant, and causing loss of use and diminution of rental value—allegations that sufficiently describe a substantial interference with quiet enjoyment.

causation.reasoning: Complaint links the deprivation of hot water and Plaintiff’s injuries directly to Defendant’s conduct/omission (notification, promise to order part, failure to expedite repair), alleging the interference resulted from Defendant’s failure to timely restore service.

damages.reasoning: Complaint alleges specific out-of-pocket expenses (gym fees, gasoline), inconvenience (transporting infant for bathing), loss of use and diminished rental value, and provides a conservative monetary estimate (~$450), which sufficiently pleads damages.
